First off I would like to say that while I only have 36.4 hours into this game on Steam at the time I am writing this review, DBD is not a new experience for me as I have put several hours into both the console version and the mobile version of the game.
With that being said, Dead By Daylight is an amazing game and while it does have its many flaws, it manages to outweigh most of the flaws through the countless hours of phenomenal gameplay that you will end up sinking into this game. 

The games premise is simple and easy to play, but hard to master!
The game goes like this...you either choose to play as a survivor or a killer.

As a survivor, your main goal is to survive the killers wrath long enough to be able to power on 5 out of 7 generators that are randomly spawned throughout the map and escape. The way avoiding the killer works is you must not get hit by them, as getting hit 2 times knocks you down and then the killer is able to bring you to "The Hook" and hang you there, forcing you to have to be rescued by a team mate. (If you are hit once you are able to either be healed by a team mate back up to the healthy state, or you can heal yourself if you have a medkit that was either brought into the match that was purchased through the Blood Web or found while playing that specific match) To put it simply, on your third hook, you die. With that being said, there are things known as "Perks" that drastically change the way you can play as a survivor such as reviving yourself, healing yourself, saving yourself from the hook one time, etc...The way you unlock said Perks is through something known as the Blood web.

The Blood Web is available for both killers and survivors, and is essentially the leveling system in DBD.
The Blood Web is leveled up through using the Blood points that you earn after each match you complete, and is separate from each and every individual survivor/killer. The Blood Web allows you to make purchases on things such as items for survivors like medkits to heal yourself, flashlights to blind the killer, toolboxes to repair gens faster etc...And offerings on killers that allows your abilities to gain additional benefits.

Speaking of the killer, the way you play one is pretty simple. Hook as many survivors as many times as you can and stop the progression of gens as much as you can through any means necessary. Each killer is unique in the way they are played and each one changes the way you play the match.

One of my absolute FAVORITE things about DBD is its amazing roster of iconic horror icons such as Leatherface, Freddy Krueger, Michael Myers, Scream, Amanda (From SAW), The Demogorgon (Stranger Things) and now Pyramid Head.
On top of all of these iconic killers, there are also iconic survivors such as Cheryl (Heather) Mason, Ash from The Evil Dead, and more!
They don't only have licensed killers, as they also have their own that they make themselves  and each one is unique in their own way when it comes to both the way they are played and the way their perks work.

Now I don't want to get to deep into how teachable perks work and what not, but long story short, each character (BOTH Survivor AND Killer) have their own perks that can be used only on them until a certain level, and then after reaching said level on said character, you now have the opportunity to learn those perks on every other character now through the Blood Web. This is where the game gets grindy, as you'll want to have the best of the best perks in the game!

In conclusion, the game is great and there are not too many negative things I can say about it other than the dedicated servers can be pretty awful at times, hackers here and there (maybe? I have only come across one at the time of writing this review) and people can be rude in the end game chat if you whoop their butt (lol)
Anyways, I DEFINITELY recommend this game, ESPECIALLY if it's on sale! (NOTE: The DLC goes on sale for this game quite often at a pretty low price, so maybe just wait till then to buy the characters, but that is up to you.

This game is developed by people who care more about cool skins and new killers, instead of making a game that actually functions.

I originally had the game on PS4 via Playstation Plus and I played it a few times but never really got into it. Fast forward to now I've played a little bit with friends and always survivor and honestly that's pretty much where I seem to have the most fun. I get playing the killer is probably fun to most people but I don't know, I like the rush of trying to escape and do generators when out of nowhere the killer snuck up on you and now you are dead meat. There is issues of course with desync and getting hit around corners but grab a group of friends and this game really shines. The DLC for it is amazing and worth the money because it's honestly handled so well and it feels like money well spent. Best asymmetric game I've played so far.

This game is pretty intense and fun when you first play. After a while, you get used to what the killer and survivors do and you try to win. The community is pretty toxic but I rarely met anyone who were rude in the game chat or trolling in game. The game does have bugs and glitches, sometimes it takes a while for the devs to even respond to it. Overall though, Dead by Daylight is a fun horror survival game that you should give it a go.

my time through the game is this "it can be fun to play and absolutely dreadful at times";
the gimmick of find generator and fix durrr... gets old, but that's really my only complaint gameplay wise, it's not janky and controls are well rounded, what does sometimes make it suck and trust me i'm not the only one to say this and i won't be the last; the community is toxic, even if you have a good game as killer and win you'll get shredded with tears from incelic g-cup mommas boys on how you didn't be friendly or you camped a hooked survivor, then call you trash when you got a 4k, but you'll get that in any game but in this you just don't see and end.

This game CAN be lots fun when playing with friends, trolling the killer and stuff. Still, after a thousand hours playing it I have to say that many are the reasons why I do not recommend it. The first and most important one is the lack of seriousness and commitment from the developers. Every update brings up some annoying bug that makes you either lose the game or having to restart it in order to run it as it should run by itself, making you waste time and patience. The second is the greed; the money. To get really good perks to play killer or survivor you must either wait for the perk to appear on the game's weekly update or BUY the DLC that carries the desired perks. The thing is, you'll pay for the game and its DLCs and then the devs will $h!t on your hand once they grabbed the money. They will not fix the bugs and they will not improve the game in absolutely any sense at all. Also, if you're a spanish speaker, get ready for the worst translation you've ever seen in your life.

But with time and familiarity the game became really fun. I highly recommend this!

Super Bom, por mais que cada partida seja o mesmo objetivo, fugir do assasino fazendo os geradores ou de assasino matar todos... Cada partida é diferente pois existem varios killers e varios survivors com perks únicos e com  muitas variedades. Eu recomendo muito que comprem o jogo. Tenho certeza que voces vao viciar demais nesse jogo maravilhoso.
